Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.logging

Class LazyLogger

java.lang.Object
org.apache.log4j.Category
org.apache.log4j.Logger
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.logging.LazyLogger
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.log4j.spi.AppenderAttachable
public class LazyLogger extends org.apache.log4j.Logger
LazyLogger is an extension of the Logger class providing lazy logging capabilities. This class enhances the performance of logging by deferring the evaluation of log messages until it is determined that the log level is enabled.

The primary features of LazyLogger include: - Lazy evaluation of log messages using Supplier<String>. - Standard logging methods that don't defer the evaluation of messages. - Utility methods inherited from the Logger class for additional functionality.

The class supports both lazy and standard logging methods for TRACE and DEBUG log levels.

  • Constructor Details

    • LazyLogger

      public LazyLogger(Class<?> clazz)
      Constructs a LazyLogger instance for a specific class. We put the constructor first since we don't have a factory method.
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class for which the logger is created.

  • Method Details

    • trace

      public void trace(Supplier<String> fMessage)
      Logs a trace message if trace logging is enabled. The message is generated lazily by invoking the supplied Supplier.
      Parameters:
      fMessage - a Supplier<String> that provides the message to log.

    • trace

      public void trace(Supplier<String> fMessage, Throwable t)
      Logs a trace message using a supplier for the message and an associated throwable, if trace level logging is enabled.
      Parameters:
      fMessage - a supplier providing the message to be logged.
      t - the throwable to be logged alongside the message.

    • debug

      public void debug(Supplier<String> fMessage)
      Logs a debug message using a lazy evaluation approach.
      Parameters:
      fMessage - a supplier that provides the debug message. The message will only be computed and logged if debug logging is enabled.

    • debug

      public void debug(Supplier<String> fMessage, Throwable t)
      Logs a debug message and an associated throwable if the debug logging level is enabled.
      Parameters:
      fMessage - the supplier providing the debug message to be logged.
      t - the throwable to be logged alongside the debug message.

    • l7dlog

      public void l7dlog(org.apache.log4j.Priority priority, String key, Object[] params, Throwable t)
      Logs a localized message with the specified priority, resource bundle key, optional parameter array, and an optional throwable.
      Overrides:
      l7dlog in class org.apache.log4j.Category
      Parameters:
      priority - the priority level of the log, representing the severity of the message.
      key - the resource bundle key for the localized message.
      params - an array of objects to be used as parameters in the localized message, can be null if no parameters are needed.
      t - an optional Throwable associated with the log message, can be null if no exception information is to be logged.

    • log

      public void log(org.apache.log4j.Priority priority, Object message, Throwable t)
      Logs a message along with a specific priority level and an associated Throwable instance. This method provides a mechanism to log detailed information with the specified priority, message, and an optional exception for better tracking and debugging.
      Overrides:
      log in class org.apache.log4j.Category
      Parameters:
      priority - the priority level of the log message (e.g., DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR).
      message - the message object to log, which can be any object that provides information.
      t - the Throwable instance to be logged, representing an exception or error, or null if no exception is to be logged.

    • removeAllAppenders

      public void removeAllAppenders()
      Removes all appenders from the underlying logger. This method detaches and clears all previously added appenders from the internal logger configuration. Use this method when you need to reset or reconfigure the logger with a clean slate of appenders.
      Specified by:
      removeAllAppenders in interface org.apache.log4j.spi.AppenderAttachable
      Overrides:
      removeAllAppenders in class org.apache.log4j.Category
